intro: Dalechampia olfersiana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or green velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Dalechampia olfersiana is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open forests.
